Name: Space Mathematics: Math Problems Based on Space Science (Dover Books on Aeronautical Engineering)

ReviewList.Text: Disappointing content.  The examples are quite old, but I expected that given the date of publication.  However the content itself is not very good.  The format of the book takes some mathematical concept  and tries to wrap it around a spaceflight idea.  However there is very little insight provided to the student.  The format is also overly verbose and hard to read. I'm a practicing aerospace engineer and teacher and I could come up with problems that are better worded and better illustrate both the mathematics and the spaceflight concepts.
I'm an adult learning math, and this book is great! It perfectly illustrates how algebra is used in one of my favorites areas of interest, astronomy! I hope NASA creates more of these!
